alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Harrison; Orange; Perry; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 3:12AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Harrison, southeastern Dubois, Crawford, northern Perry, Orange and Washington Counties through 400 AM EST/300 AM CST/... At 311 AM EST/211 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Bedford to near Boonville. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts between 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Crawford, Orange, Washington, northern Perry, southeastern Dubois and northwestern Harrison Counties, including the following locations... Campbellsburg, Livonia, Pumpkin Center, Bacon, French Lick, Syria, Rosebud, Harristown, Adyeville and Mahan Crossing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM EST/700 AM CST/ for south central Indiana.

area.areaDesc: Crawford; Dubois; Harrison; Orange; Perry; Washington
